intro: Tithymalus stocksianus, commonly known as the Stocksian tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is native to regions of Europe and western Asia. It has finely divided, aromatic leaves and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
